intro: Cyclobalanopsis glauca var. elongata, commonly known as the long-leaf chinquapin, is a species of evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Fagaceae family, which includes oaks, beeches, and chestnuts. The plant is characterized by its elongated, leathery leaves and produces small, edible nuts encased in a spiny husk. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in tropical and subtropical forests. This variant is distinguished by its longer leaves compared to the typical form of Cyclobalanopsis glauca.
